All Medical Terms

Study all 30 medical terms across 6 categories

Intermediate

Myocardial Infarction

Click to see definition

Intermediate

Myocardial Infarction

Definition:

Death of heart muscle tissue due to lack of blood supply, commonly known as a heart attack

Clinical Example:

The patient presented with chest pain and was diagnosed with an acute myocardial infarction

Basic

Hypertension

Click to see definition

Basic

Hypertension

Definition:

High blood pressure, defined as systolic pressure ‚â•140 mmHg or diastolic pressure ‚â•90 mmHg

Clinical Example:

Chronic hypertension increases the risk of stroke and kidney disease

Basic

Arrhythmia

Click to see definition

Basic

Arrhythmia

Definition:

Irregular heartbeat or abnormal heart rhythm

Clinical Example:

The ECG showed atrial fibrillation, a common type of arrhythmia

Intermediate

Atherosclerosis

Click to see definition

Intermediate

Atherosclerosis

Definition:

Hardening and narrowing of arteries due to plaque buildup

Clinical Example:

Atherosclerosis in the coronary arteries can lead to angina and heart attacks

Advanced

Cardiomyopathy

Click to see definition

Advanced

Cardiomyopathy

Definition:

Disease of the heart muscle that affects its ability to pump blood effectively

Clinical Example:

Dilated cardiomyopathy resulted in the patient's heart failure symptoms

Basic

Pneumonia

Click to see definition

Basic

Pneumonia

Definition:

Infection that inflames air sacs in one or both lungs, which may fill with fluid

Clinical Example:

Bacterial pneumonia was confirmed with chest X-ray and sputum culture

Basic

Asthma

Click to see definition

Basic

Asthma

Definition:

Chronic respiratory condition causing airway inflammation and breathing difficulties

Clinical Example:

The child's asthma was triggered by exposure to dust mites

Advanced

Pneumothorax

Click to see definition

Advanced

Pneumothorax

Definition:

Collapsed lung caused by air leaking into the space between lung and chest wall

Clinical Example:

Spontaneous pneumothorax required immediate chest tube insertion

Basic

Bronchitis

Click to see definition

Basic

Bronchitis

Definition:

Inflammation of the bronchial tubes that carry air to the lungs

Clinical Example:

Acute bronchitis typically resolves within 2-3 weeks with supportive care

Advanced

Pleural Effusion

Click to see definition

Advanced

Pleural Effusion

Definition:

Abnormal accumulation of fluid in the pleural space around the lungs

Clinical Example:

Thoracentesis was performed to drain the pleural effusion and relieve dyspnea

Basic

Stroke

Click to see definition

Basic

Stroke

Definition:

Sudden interruption of blood flow to the brain, causing brain tissue damage

Clinical Example:

The patient showed signs of acute stroke with left-sided weakness and speech difficulties

Basic

Seizure

Click to see definition

Basic

Seizure

Definition:

Sudden, uncontrolled electrical disturbance in the brain

Clinical Example:

The generalized tonic-clonic seizure lasted three minutes

Basic

Migraine

Click to see definition

Basic

Migraine

Definition:

Severe headache often accompanied by nausea, vomiting, and light sensitivity

Clinical Example:

Her migraine attacks occur monthly and respond well to triptans

Intermediate

Neuropathy

Click to see definition

Intermediate

Neuropathy

Definition:

Damage or dysfunction of peripheral nerves, often causing pain and numbness

Clinical Example:

Diabetic neuropathy caused tingling and burning sensation in his feet

Advanced

Encephalitis

Click to see definition

Advanced

Encephalitis

Definition:

Inflammation of the brain tissue, often caused by viral infection

Clinical Example:

Viral encephalitis was suspected based on fever, headache, and altered mental status

Intermediate

Melanoma

Click to see definition

Intermediate

Melanoma

Definition:

Most serious type of skin cancer that develops in melanocytes

Clinical Example:

Early detection of melanoma significantly improves treatment outcomes

Basic

Dermatitis

Click to see definition

Basic

Dermatitis

Definition:

General term for skin inflammation causing redness, swelling, and itching

Clinical Example:

Contact dermatitis developed after exposure to poison ivy

Basic

Eczema

Click to see definition

Basic

Eczema

Definition:

Chronic skin condition causing dry, itchy, and inflamed skin patches

Clinical Example:

Atopic eczema in children often improves with age and proper skin care

Intermediate

Psoriasis

Click to see definition

Intermediate

Psoriasis

Definition:

Autoimmune condition causing rapid skin cell turnover and scaly patches

Clinical Example:

Plaque psoriasis commonly affects elbows, knees, and scalp

Intermediate

Cellulitis

Click to see definition

Intermediate

Cellulitis

Definition:

Bacterial skin infection affecting deeper layers of skin and soft tissue

Clinical Example:

Cellulitis of the lower leg required immediate antibiotic treatment

Basic

Fracture

Click to see definition

Basic

Fracture

Definition:

Break in the continuity of bone tissue

Clinical Example:

The X-ray revealed a displaced fracture of the radius bone

Basic

Arthritis

Click to see definition

Basic

Arthritis

Definition:

Inflammation of joints causing pain, stiffness, and reduced range of motion

Clinical Example:

Rheumatoid arthritis affects multiple joints symmetrically

Intermediate

Osteoporosis

Click to see definition

Intermediate

Osteoporosis

Definition:

Condition where bones become weak and brittle due to loss of bone density

Clinical Example:

Postmenopausal women are at increased risk for osteoporosis

Basic

Tendonitis

Click to see definition

Basic

Tendonitis

Definition:

Inflammation of tendons, often due to overuse or repetitive motion

Clinical Example:

Tennis elbow is a common form of tendonitis affecting the lateral epicondyle

Advanced

Spondylosis

Click to see definition

Advanced

Spondylosis

Definition:

Age-related wear and tear affecting the spinal discs and vertebrae

Clinical Example:

Cervical spondylosis can cause neck pain and arm numbness

Basic

Gastritis

Click to see definition

Basic

Gastritis

Definition:

Inflammation of the stomach lining often caused by H. pylori bacteria or NSAIDs

Clinical Example:

Chronic gastritis can lead to peptic ulcers if left untreated

Basic

Appendicitis

Click to see definition

Basic

Appendicitis

Definition:

Inflammation of the appendix requiring emergency surgical removal

Clinical Example:

Acute appendicitis presents with right lower quadrant abdominal pain

Intermediate

Jaundice

Click to see definition

Intermediate

Jaundice

Definition:

Yellow discoloration of skin and eyes due to elevated bilirubin levels

Clinical Example:

Obstructive jaundice may indicate gallstone blockage of the bile duct

Advanced

Cirrhosis

Click to see definition

Advanced

Cirrhosis

Definition:

Chronic liver disease characterized by scarring and loss of liver function

Clinical Example:

Alcohol-related cirrhosis can progress to liver failure

Advanced

Ulcerative Colitis

Click to see definition

Advanced

Ulcerative Colitis

Definition:

Inflammatory bowel disease causing ulcers in the colon and rectum

Clinical Example:

Ulcerative colitis symptoms include bloody diarrhea and abdominal cramping
